name: Large modern loft with roof deck.
summary: Beatiful and unique 2300 sq foot (214 sq meter), 3 floor, penthouse loft with roofdeck. 13+ foot ceilings, modern, well appointed chefs kitchen and working wood stove. In the heart of downtown, Steps from South Station subway/bus/commuter rails.
space: It is a 3 floor, true loft, with all of the floors open to each other.  A 400 square foot private roof deck adds outdoor space that is rare in Boston.   The master suite contains a king size bed and is secluded and quiet, but being a true loft, it is still open to the unit.  The other bedroom is the lofted head house that has a double bed.  Due to the openness of the unit, it would be best for a couple, and/or a couple with a grown child (due to the number of stairs in the unit). Entire unit except for the pantry and our closets. We are more than happy to help in the planning of your stay, from transportation to local restaraunts and things to see and do while you are here.  We may be available to hand off keys (and to show the unit if guests are interested) but will not be present during the stay. The leather district is a small neighborhood consisting mostly of mixed use lofts that is very close to south station, as well as both route 93 and the mass pike.   We are located walking di

neighborhood_overview: The leather district is a small neighborhood consisting mostly of mixed use lofts that is very close to south station, as well as both route 93 and the mass pike.   We are located walking distance to most of Boston's main atractions such as the North End, Quincy Market, the Seaport district and Boston Common (all a mile or less away).
transit: Steps from South station that contains a cab stand,  local subway lines, commuter rails, busses, and the "silver line", a shuttle bus from the airport (that is usually free, but if not, it is less then $3 per person).  As well as a hubway bike rental. (website hidden)
access: Entire unit except for the pantry and our closets.
interaction: We are more than happy to help in the planning of your stay, from transportation to local restaraunts and things to see and do while you are here.  We may be available to hand off keys (and to show the unit if guests are interested) but will not be present during the stay.
house_rules: No smoking, pets or parties please.
host_about: My wife Nancy and I enjoy travelling as much, and to as far, as possible, but we also love living in downtown Boston.   We are looking forward to being able to share our unique space with people, as well as using airbnb to find unique places to stay all over the world.

name: Lux 3 floor penthouse with roof deck in Downtown
summary: Unique penthouse loft with 2500 sqft plus huge 300 sqft of private roof deck and extraordinary 30 ft. ceilings. Newly renovated 3 Bed, 3 Bath home in Boston’s Leather District. Fully equipped apartment that it will make you feel at home including a PS3 game system, smart TV and a fully equipped chefs kitchen. Offers a spacious and bright open layout with original beams, large windows, hardwood floors throughout.
space: We value the importance of communication, therefore, we respond and pre-approve guests within minutes. Dramatic one-of-a-kind tri-level Penthouse LOFT in Boston's Leather District with 2500 sqft plus huge 300 sqft of private roof deck overlooking downtown Boston! Newly renovated 3 bedroom + 3 full bathrooms + separate office space + 2 living rooms. Featuring a 30 ft ceiling height from foyer area, huge rooftop skylights flooding the space with natural light, original hardwood flooring, exposed brick & beam throughout. Dramatic remodel in 2014-2015. All of the furniture is less than 6 months old. Linens and towels are brand new; they are less than one month old. Offers a spacious and bright open layout including a large master suite with en-suite bath (full bathroom) and oversized walk-in closet. Second bedroom includes en-suite bath (full bathroom) and walk in closet as well. Third bedroom also includes a full bathroom.  The apartment is great for families and business travelers. The p

neighborhood_overview: Close proximity to public transportation, highways, restaurants, and shopping.  Only 6 min away walking from Boston Common, Macy's, supermarkets like Roche Bros and Whole Foods, convenience stores like CVS, and many retail stores. Easy and quick access to Boston Convention Center on Seaport by public transportation or by taxi. It is just 6 min away.
access: You will have the entire apartment for yourselves. Except a few kitchen cabinets that I have some personal items.
interaction: I am easily accessible (see my 100% response rate) via phone/email/text. I am thrilled to provide local recommendations but will give you total privacy.
house_rules: HOUSEHOLD RULES:  The elevator is working now!! :)  It is a residential building so all of the residential building rules apply and must be fallow. I have zero tolerance for parties, noise and smoking. Keep the order and cleanliness inside the apartment. Respecting the share areas of the building: stairs and hall, keeping them clean and in silence Starting at 21.00 hours until 09.00 hours are quite hours.  ANY EXCESSIVE NOISE, LOUD MUSIC AND PARTIES ARE STRICTLY FORBIDDEN! In case of complaints from the neighbors due to excessive noise or annoying behavior by any people in your group, the owner has the right to expel the client and all guests from the apartment whether it is during the day or night, without giving any refund of the amount already paid for the reservation, and to keep the security deposit.  As part of the service we include a complementary iPhone that you can use during your stay. You must leave the phone and charger in the same box that you found it. The box will be in

name: Boston Financial District - Location and charm
summary: Great spot right in the Financial District. 2 Blocks from South Station. You can't beat this location - convenient to everything downtown. Cool loft in an historic building from the early 1900's, a former shoe factory. In the '80's, the neighborhood was converted into studios by artists. This loft was built out by a painter/photographer. It still has its artistic roots, with the guest room itself being the original dark room converted to a bedroom. Unique!
space: This is one of the best locations in Boston. It is right downtown two blocks from South Station. It can't be beat. The loft has 13 foot ceilings, skylights and windows allowing for tons of sunlight, a wonderful roof deck with downtown views, and the original artistic layout makes for a very unique feel. The living space is all open, and consists of a dining "room", TV "room", reading "room", piano "room", and full kitchen which is open to those common "rooms". There are 2 huge, comfy couches. And there is almost always an in-process woodworking or junk art project, so please be open to and non-judgmental about creativity! :-)
description: Great spot right in the Financial District. 2 Blocks from South Station. You can't beat this location - convenient to everything downtown. Cool loft in an historic building from the early 1900's, a former shoe factory. In the '80's, the neighborhood was converted into studios by artists. This loft was built out by a painter/photographer. It still has its artistic roots, with the guest room itself being the original dark room converted to a bedroom. Unique! This is one of the best locations in Boston. It is right downtown two blocks from South Station. It can't be beat. The living space is all open, and consists of a dining "room", TV "room", reading "room", piano "room", and full kitchen which is open to those common "rooms". There are 2 huge, comfy couches. And there is almost always an in-process
neighborhood_overview: 2 blocks from South Station. Great French restaurant across the street with live Jazz daily. The famous South Street Diner, open 24 hrs, is a block away. Also close to Downtown Crossing, Boston Common, Chinatown, and the Seaport. The tiny couple-block area around the building is known as the historic "Leather District" (wikipedia it) because it was the home of Boston's leather goods industry at the turn of the century. Now it is converted lofts.
notes: This is a family building, with only 4 residential units, and the neighbors are very nice people. But they really like their peace and quiet, so please be respectful of that. These converted warehouse buildings are awesome, but sounds travels very well in them! And we recently had the front entryway of our buidling redone, and the doors refinished - please please try to be gentle with them (we're still in the "new door honeymoon stage" haha).
transit: South Station is 1 block away. Walking distance to all subway ("T") lines. Short walk to the Financial District, Seaport, Boston Common, Chinatown. Of course there is Uber and Lyft, but if you still love traditional taxi cabs, there is a 24-hour taxi stand 1 block away at South Station. Oh, free Silver Line T bus from the airport to South Station - so it's free to get to the loft from Logan!
access: This is downtown loft living as authentic as it gets. Enjoy the wonderful roof deck, just be careful, please. The room you are renting is the former darkroom from the painter/photographer who originally built out the space, converted into a bedroom. There is a queen size bed, and please note that on each side there are a couple of steps up to get up to its elevated platform. The room is amazing for sleeping, and watching TV/movies. But it's quite small, so it's not good for sitting. And since it's a former darkroom, there are no windows, and it's not good for enjoying the great natural sunlight the loft gets. So, guests are welcome to use the shared open loft space and its various "rooms" (mentioned previously). The loft is the penthouse unit on top floor of the building, so it's 5 long flights of stairs, and there is no elevator. So, be ready for your exercise! If you really dislike stairs, then this is not the best apartment for you. And while the original wood floors are beautiful,
interaction: As the listing reflects, you are renting a private room in an owner-occupied apartment. My roommate, Jeff, owns the loft, lives there in the main bedroom in the back part of the loft, and will be there in person (we AirBnB my room when I will be staying at my farm outside the city). So, you will be sharing the apartment with the owner. I will be available by cell phone. Feel free to ask either of us if you need something during your stay.
house_rules: - Be careful on rooftop deck, and on steep stairs up to it. - Please keep noise level down, with quiet rule after 10pm

name: Rare, Spacious Loft in the Heart of Downtown
summary: You don't get any closer to the heart of downtown Boston than this spot. And you also don't get such a spacious loft - fantastic for entertainment space - with this rate! Within a 15-minute walk, you'll arrive at all the major Boston neighborhoods - Back Bay, Seaport, North End, Downtown Crossing and more! You're next to the top nightclubs, across from South Station Amtrak Terminal, surrounded by comedy clubs and restaurants. In short, there's so much energy here and so much loft to enjoy!
space: This is an 1800 square foot loft with industrial character. The building used to be a leather factory in the early 1900s and you can see its charm with stainless steel doors throughout, exposed central HVAC ductwork, and an indoor garage door! The beautiful open layout lets the kitchen, living room, and overall space flow seamlessly throughout.

name: Lux Penthouse with roof deck in Downtown
summary: Striking Loft Penthouse with sensational view of downtown Boston. Spacious 2 bed and 2 full bathroom with open format kitchen, living and dining room.  Fully equipped open cooks kitchen. Direct access to private roof deck. With built-in gas grill and outdoor shower. Easy access to major transportation hubs: South Station, Rtes 93N/S, Mass Pike. + Dishwasher, Dryer, Garbage disposal, Microwave, Oven, Refrigerator, Washer.
space: Cozy, yet large space to enjoy with family and friends.
